Key Match Events: Miami Heat's last-second victory over Minnesota Timberwolves.
Erik Spoelstra's clever inbounds play setup leading to a game-winning layup.
Nickeil-Alexander Walker and Anthony Edwards' defensive switch mistake.
Tyler Herro's key defensive play against DeMar DeRozan.
Miami's effective zone defense holding Minnesota to 0.87 points-per-possession.
Miami scoring 26 fast-break points with 14 steals.

Herro's comments on learning from last year's playoffs and improving his game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami Heat's offensive and defensive ratings after the game.
Minnesota's defensive setup compared to a football cover zero.
Miami's strategic use of zone defense in the fourth quarter.
Miami's shot selection focusing on upper paint shots and corner threes.
Minnesota's low fast-break points despite having 13 steals.
